To administer and troubleshoot your cluster, you can connect to it using SSH and then run commands. To connect, specify the IP address of your core and the location of your RSA private key, for <<<<<<< HEAD example:ssh ubuntu@203.0.113.0 -i ~/.ssh/myPrivateKey.pemFor more information, see the .Terminating Instances and Security Groups from the Command Line
To terminate your instance and its security groups, run the following command and enter yes when prompted:This action will delete all of your managed infrastructure and it cannot be undone. For more information, see the Terraform documentation on Command: Destroy.terraform destroy -var-file=<myVariables>.tfvarsFor more information, see Terraform Variables.
Terraform cleanly terminates the instance and the security groups associated with it.If the destroy process enters a loop, delete the terraform.tfstate file and run the command again.To Terminate Instances and Security Groups from <keyword <<<<<<< HEAD keyref="pubCloudShort"/>

Click Delete Security Groups.
======= Congratulations! You are now ready to begin deploying apps to your new sandbox environment. We have provided some sample applications in multiple programming languages for you to examine and deploy. These very simple applications provide insight on how to push applications and connect those applications to services.
